text:
Lee Cha-su (; also written as Lee Cha-soo, 6 June 1957 – 9 March 2020) was a South Korean politician and social activist who called for the resettlement of the K-2 Air Force Base used at Daegu International Airport. He was the chairman of the Buk-gu Council.
Lee died in Chilgok, Buk District, Daegu at the age of 62 due to coronavirus (COVID-19) on 9 March 2020.
